name: Lunges
how_to_perform:
1. Stand up straight with your feet hip-width apart.
2. Place your hands on your hips or let them hang by your sides.
3. Take a step forward with your right foot, roughly two to three feet in front of your standing foot.
4. Lower your body by bending both knees until your front thigh is parallel to the ground and your back knee almost touches the floor. Your front knee should not extend past your toes.
5. Keep your torso upright and your core engaged throughout the movement.
6. Hold the lunge position briefly, then push back up to the starting position by pressing through the heel of your forward foot.
7. Alternate legs on each repetition or complete all repetitions on one leg before switching to the other.
short_summary: A lunge is a lower body exercise that targets the legs and glutes by taking a large step forward and lowering the hips.
